intro: Hemizonia parryi subsp. congdonii, commonly known as the Congdon's hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss, while its flowers are usually yellow or orange. It is often found in scrublands and canyons, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
